title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard, the context for nested classes is not being determined correctly.
OB: When using the new class wizard, if an existing .java file is open in the editor and the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox is checked, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank.
EB: When using the new class wizard, if an existing .java file is open in the editor and the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox is checked, the 'Enclosing Type' field should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open a .java file in the editor. 
2. Click the 'New Class' button. 
3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' checkbox. 
4. Observe that the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank, instead of defaulting to the current type in the editor.
